comments:
I'm not sure if this has a reproducable test case, but Eclipse commonly dies
(nicely though...saves before closing) when trying to open the manifest editor.

I've just had this happen twice to me. Once in the Package Explorer view,
drilling into my external plug-in libraries project, into the runtime jar and
then clicking on the manifest.

The other time it was in the Plug-in Dependancy view and focusing on the
update.configurator and then clicking on a dependant plug-in.

Veronika, is this an SWT issue?

hmm....might be some deeper machine thing... I had errors trying to start
Eclipse the next time. (could not set text, then not enough handles, then it
worked the 3rd time)

I suggest printing this bug report and attaching it to a request for a new 
laptop :-)

You could call OS.GetLastError() to find out more about what went wrong.

It generally means your application is leaking and can't allocate enough 
resources but the error code woul dgive mre information.
DJ, are you using as your host the basic Eclipse or do you have add-ons?
I have about 300 plug-ins including emf, wst, etc. etc...

then although I feel your pain, I will close as INVALID since the argument 
that it's a PDE (or Eclipse) issue for that matter won't hold up in court.

I point the finger at the add-ons that are leaking resources thus preventing 
context menus from coming up :(
